decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a highly aggressive and efficient creature lineup. The deck aims to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure by playing a stream of strong creatures such as Questing Beast, Lovestruck Beast, and Kazandu Mammoth. The deck also includes disruption and removal options like Thrashing Brontodon and Gemrazer to deal with opponent's threats. To support the aggressive strategy, the deck utilizes mana acceleration through cards like The Great Henge and Castle Garenbrig. Faceless Haven acts as a mana sink and provides additional attack options.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on delaying the opponent's strategy while ramping up mana to play powerful late-game threats like Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany. The deck includes removal spells like Heartless Act and Shadows' Verdict to control the board, along with card draw options like Omen of the Sea to maintain card advantage. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion, providing additional value by blinking permanents for extra ETB triggers. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with a mix of control elements and high-impact threats.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively cycle through cards with cards like Drannith Stinger, Valiant Rescuer, and Flourishing Fox while building up a strong board presence. By utilizing cards like Zenith Flare and Irencrag Pyromancer, the deck aims to deal direct damage to your opponent while also gaining card advantage. The deck also includes some defensive options like Improbable Alliance and Frostveil Ambush to help control the board. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with an aggressive cycling strategy while maintaining versatility and adaptability.

The deck focuses on quickly summoning powerful creatures like Winota, Joiner of Forces and Blade Historian onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. Using cards like Selfless Savior and Alseid of Life's Bounty to protect key creatures, the deck aims to maximize Winota's ability to put multiple creatures into play with her triggers. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Kenrith, the Returned King and Reidane, God of the Worthy to provide additional value and disruption to the opponent's game plan. With a mix of creatures and protection spells, this deck aims to quickly close out games with powerful attacks.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on playing powerful creatures like Questing Beast, Goldspan Dragon, and Lovestruck Beast to quickly overwhelm your opponent. The deck also includes support cards like Embercleave and The Great Henge to give your creatures additional strength and abilities. With a mix of high-powered threats and versatile removal spells like Fire Prophecy, this deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and end the game quickly. By utilizing the strong synergy between creatures and powerful spells, this deck aims to outpace and outmuscle the opponent in a fast-paced matchup.

The deck focuses on building a fast and aggressive board presence with efficient creatures and a few removal spells. Utilizing cards like Lovestruck Beast and Giant Killer, the deck aims to pressure opponents early and maintain that pressure with follow-up threats like Clarion Spirit and Elite Spellbinder. Showdown of the Skalds provides a huge boost in card advantage and tempo, while Jegantha, the Wellspring offers additional mana ramp and versatility. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and efficient plays to secure victory quickly.

The main concept of this Naya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Clarion Spirit and Lovestruck Beast to create a wide board presence and Bonecrusher Giant for removal, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent. Showdown of the Skalds provides additional card advantage and can help close out games quickly. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds consistency to the mana base while still allowing for a strong aggressive strategy.

The main focus of this Sultai Control deck is to maintain a strong control over the game by utilizing a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and hand disruption. The deck includes powerful threats like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Valki, God of Lies, as well as card advantage engines like Mazemind Tome and Emergent Ultimatum. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in longer games. By carefully managing resources and answering threats efficiently, this deck aims to outlast opponents and take over the game with its powerful late-game threats.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells and counterspells, while also generating card advantage with cards like Mazemind Tome and Omen of the Sea. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by efficiently dealing with threats and eventually winning the game with powerful finishers like Shark Typhoon and Kaervek, the Spiteful. The deck also includes a companion in the form of Yorion, Sky Nomad, providing additional value by flickering permanents for extra value. It aims to outlast the opponent and grind them out of resources while maintaining control of the game.

The deck relies on aggressive creatures like Valiant Rescuer, Drannith Stinger, and Flourishing Fox, combined with cycling cards to quickly generate tokens and deal damage. Zenith Flare is the finisher, using the number of cycling cards in the graveyard to burn the opponent for lethal damage. The deck also includes some control elements with cards like Neutralize and Frostveil Ambush, while maintaining consistency through card draw with Improbable Alliance and Boon of the Wish-Giver. Needleverge Pathway, Raugrin Triome, Riverglide Pathway, and Hengegate Pathway provide mana fixing for the three-color deck.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up resources and generating card advantage. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion provides additional value and flexibility in the deck's strategy. The deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through incremental advantages and powerful finishers like Alrund's Epiphany and Shark Typhoon. The mana base is built to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells of different colors.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells and creatures to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage and ramping into powerful late-game threats. The deck includes a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and board wipes to control the battlefield while also using ramp and card draw effects to accelerate its own game plan. By utilizing Yorion as a companion, the deck can further increase its value by flickering permanents for additional ETB effects and card advantage. The end goal is to outvalue and outpace the opponent to secure victory.

The Sultai Control deck focuses on using powerful removal spells, counterspells, and card draw to control the game while ramping up mana to play big threats and game-winning spells. The deck includes a mixture of efficient removal spells like Eliminate and Heartless Act, along with powerful threats like Polukranos, Unchained and Elder Gargaroth. With the help of cards like Emergent Ultimatum and Yorion, Sky Nomad, the deck aims to outvalue and outcontrol the opponent to grind out a victory.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on utilizing the companion mechanic, with Yorion, Sky Nomad as the chosen companion. The deck aims to control the game by utilizing a mix of removal spells like Eliminate and Heartless Act, counterspells like Mystical Dispute, and board wipes like Shadows' Verdict and Extinction Event. The deck also includes card advantage and ramp elements with cards like Emergent Ultimatum, Cultivate, and Sea Gate Restoration. The deck's key concept is to maintain control of the game through removal, disruption, and using Yorion's ability to blink permanents for extra value.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to maximize value from entering the battlefield triggers. The deck includes a variety of removal spells and counterspells to control the opponent's board, while also ramping up with cards like Cultivate and Quandrix Cultivator. The deck aims to establish board control through cards like Shadows' Verdict and Emergent Ultimatum, eventually overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Alrund's Epiphany. The deck's game plan revolves around generating card advantage, controlling the board, and eventually seizing victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the synergy between creatures and powerful spells in order to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By combining efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast with powerful spells like The Great Henge and Alrund's Epiphany, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and maintain control of the battlefield. Additionally, the inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency and power to the deck's game plan.
